title: 'Controlled explosion' outside US embassy in London, confirms UK Police
content: London's Metropolitan Police conducted a controlled explosion near the US Embassy in Nine Elms after a suspicious package was reported. The area was cordoned off as a precaution, and authorities confirmed the explosion was part of their safety procedures. Investigations are ongoing to ensure the area is secure.
summary: London's Metropolitan Police conducted a controlled explosion near the US Embassy in Nine Elms after a suspicious package was reported. The area was cordoned off as a precaution, and authorities confirmed the explosion was part of their safety procedures. Investigations are ongoing to ensure the area is secure.

title: Once Robert F Kennedy Jr blasted Donald Trump as 'threat to democracy' and compared him to Hitler
content: Robert F Kennedy Jr, recently tapped as Donald Trump's secretary of health and human services, was once a vocal critic of the former president. Recordings reveal Kennedy compared Trump's rhetoric and leadership style to Hitler and Mussolini, accusing him of exploiting fear and prejudice. Despite his past criticisms, Kennedy now expresses support for Trump's vision.
summary: Robert F Kennedy Jr, recently tapped as Donald Trump's secretary of health and human services, was once a vocal critic of the former president.  Recordings reveal Kennedy compared Trump's rhetoric and leadership style to Hitler and Mussolini, accusing him of exploiting fear and prejudice. Despite his past criticisms, Kennedy now expresses support for Trump's vision.

title: 'Backdoor way to control access': Musk slams Australia's proposed ban on social media for children
content: Elon Musk criticized a proposed Australian law that would ban social media access for children under 16. The law, announced by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, would require age verification and impose hefty fines on non-compliant companies. Musk called it an attempt to control internet access for all Australians, escalating his ongoing disputes with the Australian government over social media regulations.
summary: Elon Musk criticized a proposed Australian law that would ban social media access for children under 16.  The law, announced by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, would require age verification and impose hefty fines on non-compliant companies. Musk called it an attempt to control internet access for all Australians, escalating his ongoing disputes with the Australian government over social media regulations.

title: Donald Trump’s education pick Linda McMahon was sued over alleged role in enabling child abuse: Report
content: A lawsuit alleges that Linda McMahon, US President-elect Donald Trump's nominee for education secretary, and her husband Vince McMahon, enabled the sexual exploitation of children by a WWE employee in the 1980s. The McMahons, who deny the allegations, are accused of ignoring reports of abuse and rehiring the employee after initially firing him.
summary: A lawsuit alleges that Linda McMahon, US President-elect Donald Trump's nominee for education secretary, and her husband Vince McMahon, enabled the sexual exploitation of children by a WWE employee in the 1980s. The McMahons, who deny the allegations, are accused of ignoring reports of abuse and rehiring the employee after initially firing him.

title: 'Attempt to poison me did not work': Brazil's Lula reveals assassination plot against him as Bolsonaro faces coup allegations
content: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva revealed an alleged plot to poison him and Vice President Geraldo Alckmin before they took office in 2022. The revelation comes amid accusations that former President Jair Bolsonaro was involved in a coup attempt following his election loss. Bolsonaro denies the allegations on X.
summary: Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva revealed an alleged plot to poison him and Vice President Geraldo Alckmin before they took office in 2022. The revelation comes amid accusations that former President Jair Bolsonaro was involved in a coup attempt following his election loss. Bolsonaro denies the allegations on X.

title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.4 hits Afghanistan
content: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Badakhshan region at 6:35 am IST, according to the National Centre of Seismology (NCS). The earthquake's epicenter was at a depth of 82 kilometers. This seismic event follows two earlier earthquakes in the region this week, highlighting the region's vulnerability to such natural occurrences.
summary: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake struck Afghanistan's Badakhshan region at 6:35 am IST, according to the National Centre of Seismology (NCS). The earthquake's epicenter was at a depth of 82 kilometers. This seismic event follows two earlier earthquakes in the region this week, highlighting the region's vulnerability to such natural occurrences.

title: 'There is no equivalence': Joe Biden calls ICC warrant for Israeli PM Netanyahu 'outrageous'
content: US President Joe Biden has condemned the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, including Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, deeming them "outrageous." The White House firmly rejected the warrants, questioning the ICC's jurisdiction and expressing unwavering support for Israel's security. Republican lawmakers echoed these sentiments, with some proposing sanctions against the ICC.
summary: US President Joe Biden has condemned the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, including Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, deeming them "outrageous."  The White House firmly rejected the warrants, questioning the ICC's jurisdiction and expressing unwavering support for Israel's security. Republican lawmakers echoed these sentiments, with some proposing sanctions against the ICC.

title: Trudeau to cut sales tax and send checks to millions of Canadians as election looms
content: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced a plan to combat rising living costs. The plan includes sending checks of 250 Canadian dollars to millions of Canadians and temporarily lifting the federal sales tax on various items. This measure comes as Trudeau faces declining popularity ahead of a potential election.
summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced a plan to combat rising living costs. The plan includes sending checks of 250 Canadian dollars to millions of Canadians and temporarily lifting the federal sales tax on various items. This measure comes as Trudeau faces declining popularity ahead of a potential election.

title: Meet Pam Bondi, Trump’s pick for US attorney general
content: Former Florida attorney general Pam Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, has been named the US attorney general nominee. Known for her tough stance on crime and conservative views, Bondi's nomination signals a potential shift in the Department of Justice's priorities, with an expected focus on issues like immigration and religious freedoms.
summary: Former Florida attorney general Pam Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, has been named the US attorney general nominee. Known for her tough stance on crime and conservative views, Bondi's nomination signals a potential shift in the Department of Justice's priorities, with an expected focus on issues like immigration and religious freedoms.

title: Russia plots to target US-linked defence projects: US intelligence
content: US intelligence officials are warning American defense companies, especially those supporting Ukraine, to bolster their security against potential Russian sabotage. Concerns stem from a pattern of Russia-linked sabotage in Europe, including arson attacks, raising fears of similar incidents impacting US companies domestically and abroad. Officials urge heightened security protocols and caution regarding online information sharing.
summary: US intelligence officials are warning American defense companies, especially those supporting Ukraine, to bolster their security against potential Russian sabotage.  Concerns stem from a pattern of Russia-linked sabotage in Europe, including arson attacks, raising fears of similar incidents impacting US companies domestically and abroad.  Officials urge heightened security protocols and caution regarding online information sharing.

title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un accuses US of 'aggressive and hostile' policies, warns of nuclear war risk
'Freak off': Sean Diddy Comb’s lawyers claim video of alleged assault on girlfriend was 'manipulated'
content: Sean Diddy Combs's lawyers are challenging a video presented by prosecutors that allegedly shows him attacking his ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura. The defence claims the video is edited and misrepresents the 2016 incident, arguing it depicts a domestic dispute over belongings, not sex trafficking as prosecutors allege. They plan to present a forensic video analyst at Combs's bail hearing.
summary: Sean Diddy Combs's lawyers are challenging a video presented by prosecutors that allegedly shows him attacking his ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura. The defence claims the video is edited and misrepresents the 2016 incident, arguing it depicts a domestic dispute over belongings, not sex trafficking as prosecutors allege. They plan to present a forensic video analyst at Combs's bail hearing.

title: Joe Biden forgets Celtics' name, reveals secret service code during team's White House visit
content: President Biden welcomed the 2024 NBA champion Boston Celtics to the White House, playfully questioning their identity before highlighting the team's values and the unifying power of sports. Biden, who revealed his Secret Service code name is "Celtic," drew a parallel to John F. Kennedy hosting the Celtics in 1963, emphasizing the tradition of celebrating champions at the White House.
summary: President Biden welcomed the 2024 NBA champion Boston Celtics to the White House, playfully questioning their identity before highlighting the team's values and the unifying power of sports. Biden, who revealed his Secret Service code name is "Celtic," drew a parallel to John F. Kennedy hosting the Celtics in 1963, emphasizing the tradition of celebrating champions at the White House.

title: Donald Trump taps loyalist Pam Bondi for US attorney general after Matt Gaetz withdraws
content: Pam Bondi has been named as US Attorney General by Donald Trump, succeeding Matt Gaetz, who withdrew amid a federal investigation. Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, previously defended him in his first impeachment trial and supported him during his recent hush money trial. Trump praised Bondi's commitment and outlined his vision for the Department of Justice to prioritise crime fighting and national security.
summary: Pam Bondi has been named as US Attorney General by Donald Trump, succeeding Matt Gaetz, who withdrew amid a federal investigation. Bondi, a staunch Trump ally, previously defended him in his first impeachment trial and supported him during his recent hush money trial. Trump praised Bondi's commitment and outlined his vision for the Department of Justice to prioritise crime fighting and national security.

title: ‘Anti-semitic’: Netanyahu responds to ICC arrest warrant for alleged Gaza war crimes
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has condemned the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants against him and former defense minister Yoav Gallant for alleged war crimes, comparing the situation to the Dreyfus affair. The warrants pertain to alleged crimes committed during Israel's military campaign in Gaza, which Netanyahu defended.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has condemned the International Criminal Court's issuance of arrest warrants against him and former defense minister Yoav Gallant for alleged war crimes, comparing the situation to the Dreyfus affair. The warrants pertain to alleged crimes committed during Israel's military campaign in Gaza, which Netanyahu defended.

title: US regulators seek to break up Google, forcing Chrome sale as monopoly penalty
Prince Harry jokes about getting a tattoo on his a** in hilarious video with singer Jelly Roll
content: Prince Harry teamed up with country singer Jelly Roll for a playful promotional video for the upcoming Invictus Games. The video features Harry pretending to get his first tattoo from Jelly Roll, who jokingly inks "I am Jelly Roll" on Harry's neck. The lighthearted exchange promotes Jelly Roll's performance at the Games' closing ceremony in Vancouver in February 2025.
summary: Prince Harry teamed up with country singer Jelly Roll for a playful promotional video for the upcoming Invictus Games. The video features Harry pretending to get his first tattoo from Jelly Roll, who jokingly inks "I am Jelly Roll" on Harry's neck. The lighthearted exchange promotes Jelly Roll's performance at the Games' closing ceremony in Vancouver in February 2025.

title: How pollster Nate Silver's claim about JD Vance being venture capitalist Peter Thiel's 'worst' political bet turned out to be wrong?
content: A resurfaced video shows Nate Silver and Ezra Klein discussing Peter Thiel's political bets, particularly focusing on JD Vance. They speculated that Vance might be Thiel's worst political bet. However, Vance's vice-presidential win alongside Trump's victory challenges their claim, highlighting Thiel's successful investment in Vance's political journey.
summary: A resurfaced video shows Nate Silver and Ezra Klein discussing Peter Thiel's political bets, particularly focusing on JD Vance. They speculated that Vance might be Thiel's worst political bet. However, Vance's vice-presidential win alongside Trump's victory challenges their claim, highlighting Thiel's successful investment in Vance's political journey.

title: Ukraine claims Russia fired ICBM; mid-range missile, says Putin
Top controversies of Matt Gaetz: From inviting an internet troll to Trump's address to personal attack on Michael Cohen​
content: Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration as Donald Trump's attorney general, citing ongoing federal sex trafficking investigations as a distraction. Gaetz, known for courting controversy, has faced scrutiny for various actions, including inviting an internet troll to Trump's State of the Union address and personal attacks on political opponents.
summary: Matt Gaetz withdrew from consideration as Donald Trump's attorney general, citing ongoing federal sex trafficking investigations as a distraction. Gaetz, known for courting controversy, has faced scrutiny for various actions, including inviting an internet troll to Trump's State of the Union address and personal attacks on political opponents.
